website_summaries.verdict: Popular scanner includes several helpful automatic features, though it costs a little more than some other options.
pros: Fast scanner completes up to 12 double-sided pages/min
cons: Doesn't seem to work as well with Mac

customer_reviews.title: Does not scan ID card (drivers license)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my small office to use for scanning documents, business cards and ID cards, which most people use their drivers license for this. This scanner says in its advertising that it is good for scanning ID cards, which most are plastic! We have had this less than a month and the documents have quit feeding thru. In the manual it states DO NOT scan plastic cards... so it is not good for scanning ID cards. so this is false advertising by amazon which will not let me return an over 200$ scanner they stated was good for scanning ID cards, this is crap for that purpose. do not buy if you need a scanner for plastic cards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best little scanner around
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of Scan Snap for years. I have had a couple of the S510's...then my IT Professional told me about this smaller, more compact model. I love how small it folds up on my desktop. It is quick to scan and the quality is outstanding. Pages stay separated, but you probably can't put in more than 7-8 at a time to ensure a smooth ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is a piece of junk. I have the Fujtsu ix500 at work and it is fantastic. I thought this would be a good scanner for home. It has trouble separating if you put more than 3 sheets of paper in. I ended up feeding sheet by sheet to prevent jams. Then, after about 4 months, it completely stopped feeding paper. Sounds like the rollers are on, but no movement of paper. Total waste of money. Just get the ix500 from the get-go. So disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TBClark

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT!! You shoudl know before you buy it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on November 2017. It still works great. After recent MacOS upgrade to 64bit Catalina, It stopped working, then I found this.. It's one of the models that support periods have expired and no further updates will be provided. Ironically, Fujitsu still sells this items on Amazon....
customer_reviews.author: JESS

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner with Duplex
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely my favorite brand of scanner. This is the second one I have purchased so I am very familiar with operating it. I love that you can scan duplex. I did have to go to the website to get the software for it so that took a bit of time & expertise. But it is working fine and I will stick with the Fujitsu ScanSnap brand. I scan all sizes (e.g receipts) and it handles them just fine. I also turn everything into Adobe PDF files but will do other types of files as well. I purchased the Adobe separately.
customer_reviews.author: C Odio

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item on Amazon. I was technically not qualified to do this so I called scansnap support and a lovely person named Laura walk me through step by step how to load and use all the functions of this scanner and I am now extremely happy with this product thank you scansnap for having tech support Personnel that are user-friendly! just to clarify, the problem wasn't with the software it was so with the software installer,me . Thanks again Laura for all the help.
customer_reviews.author: Jaykall7

customer_reviews.title: Love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: Love this scanner. I was using an earlier version that is also fantistic (7 years old I believe). I bought this one because of how compact it is. I use the new one in the office and I keep the older one at home for when I am able to work a day from home. I like that I can connect either machine to my laptop seamlessly, no confusion with the software.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Puerto

customer_reviews.title: replacing old Fujitsu S300 - still awesome, very few changes, works with my Mac
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner. Got it to replace an 8-yr old one, which is almost identical to this new one, lol. Very little has changed. The easy to use and learn interface is slightly updated from the old version but works the same, so no learning curve for me. This scanner makes it possible for me to have a paperless office. No files to store, no manuals to keep track of, etc. It's small, super fast and scans both sides of a page at the same time. Can't live without it.
customer_reviews.author: GaiasJewels

customer_reviews.title: Easy and efficient portable scanner - best ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the scanner for a month and I am very happy with my purchase. It scans quickly with no problems. I love that it does duplex scanning automatically but if the back side of a page is blank it skips it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Tagget

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IT - From a former avid fan
customer_reviews.text: I used to give this scanner 5 stars but it is totally worthless now. We bought 3 of them for the office but they never seem to work reliably with Windows 10. They waste us so much time. Save yourself trouble and buy something else. Fujitsu never updated their firmware/software and it will not work with newer computers.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: As good or better than the first one!
customer_reviews.text: I have used an earlier version of this model of the Scansnap scanner for more than 7 years and truly loved it. I had to buy a new one only when Apple's latest operating system would not work with the old one. Not a complete loss, the old one works with my wife's computer since she has not upgraded the operating system. It is easy to use, does both sides of a page, and can scan multiple pages (probably not more than 10) at a time. A great product. I have not had occasion to use technical support with this version, but they were great with the earlier version, although I seldom needed technical support.
customer_reviews.author: harpswell139

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner. Fast, high resolution scans, easy to setup and even easier to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have scanned over 1000 photos and this baby just hums along happily scanning it's heart out. It was extremely easy to set-up and connect to my MAC. I researched a lot of scanners, read review and decided on this one. I am glad I did. Using it couldn't be easier. I am impressed with the quality of the scans too. Just what I wanted. Now all my family pics are digital and I can toss those two storage tubs of photos! Yay!! Tax documents are next!!!! Best. Purchase. Ever!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Daly

customer_reviews.title: Good idea poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: Hardware seems good but proprietary software is annoying and cable management makes storage a pain. The fact that it cant run on usb power might just be a technical limitation of the idea in and of itself, but it makes it so you have to track that many more things which kind of makes this less practical as a portable tool; especially when you ad on the fact that their proprietary software needs to be loaded from a cd or by manually entering a url in the manual
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Scanner double-sided or single
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and good software. takes all different sizes pictures up to 8.5x11. Extremely small pictures must be mounted on a backing sheet. Will not scan rigid pictures since it requires picture to bend slightly as it is fed thru scanner. Scan results only had 1 picture out of 500 that did not get a great image. This was a picture with a rough herringbone surface. Regular, Silver plate, bad quality pictures work well. Glossy pictures will have to be pushed until it starts feeding. Generally fed one picture at a time. But can auto feed stacks of a few pictures of same or different sizes. Scans to PDF or JPEG files.
customer_reviews.author: Hornbeck D

customer_reviews.title: DOA, and annoying software aquisition
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it was DOA out of the box. I'll alter my review once the replacement arrives. In addition, the hoops one has to jump through to download software from the Fujitsu site are less than stellar - individual downloads, including one that requires you to fill out a form to be emailed a link and credentials , to be redirected to a page that refuses those same credentials, back to the email which gives you another link with the credentials embedded in the URL, which then tells you it's a phishing site because of those credentials. C'mon Fujitsu. Stop that.
customer_reviews.author: Laxidaisy

customer_reviews.title: Not upgrading to 64 bit -Catalina
customer_reviews.text: Scanner is now a doorstop. They have a history of not upgrading software. Would not buy again from company. No excuse for this since almost all others have upgraded to 64 bit! They should let people know before they buy it may not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: B Sampson

customer_reviews.title: MISFEEDS MULTI-PAGE DOCUMENTS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Brother ADS1500W that skewed docs during feeding, sometimes ruining the doc. This one does not skew BUT has a problem feeding any multiple page document; feeds 2 or more pages at the same time. I have to feed multi-page documents one page at a time! Since the majority of my work involves scanning single pages without skewing, and I'm tired of trying to find the perfect reasonably priced scanner, this will have to suffice. BTW this is NOT a wireless scanner.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo57

customer_reviews.title: Stopped grabbing pages
customer_reviews.text: I have had Fujitus ScanSnap Scanners before and wanted a smaller version. This one worked slower than my original but still worked. The past 2 months I have been dealing with this version slowing down and eventually stopped grabbing pages to scan. Tech Support and customer service have prompted some basic level assistance but ultimately their suggestion was to buy a new one. Not please that within 18 months the product is completely useless for $250.
customer_reviews.author: mrclean

customer_reviews.title: Fujitsu's ScanSnap---A Hard Look at Software and Service
customer_reviews.text: Despite adequate warning, Fujitsu software providers neglected to offer a patch for the S1300 once Apple iOS Catalina entered the marketplace. Because of our positive history with ScanSnap, we opted to upgrade our scanner to the S1300i rather than spite Fujitsu and research another, more forward-thinking vendor. Still, the lack of software preparation as evidenced by the former will not guarantee against a vendor change in the future.
customer_reviews.author: CenCali

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I have the ix500 for home use. Needed a smaller scanner for use at our condo in AZ. Bought the ix100, but after one year, got frustrated due to poor engineering of the manual paper feed. Originals often went through crooked and “ate” them and to do 2-sided originals, you had to feed both sides. Got fed up with multiple attempts at scanning multi-page, doube-sided docs do I got this s1300i as a compromise. Smaller than the ix500 and bigger than the ix100, but has auto feed, duplex scanning with one pass through the scanner, and works a lot like the ix500 without the size. Regret I didn’t know about this scanner before I got the ix100.
customer_reviews.author: Atom

customer_reviews.title: Software: great. hardware (particularly sheet feeder): terrible.
customer_reviews.text: The good: it works seamlessly on the software side, saves scans right to Dropbox or numerous other locations. The bad: the sheet feeder is so incredibly finicky. You put papers in, and sometimes it sees them there, other times it doesn't, and you have to take the paper out/jiggle it around in order to get the sheet feeder to recognize that it's there. The guide arms don't move smoothly, so it's hard to get them to fit around any particular piece of paper. The sheet feeder also jams a lot, and takes two or more sheets at once rather than one at a time a lot. It's really irritating, and makes scanning jobs take twice as long as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gowder

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with 32-bit Apple iOS Catalina and beyond and never will
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these little scanners -- they are great. But learned today that none them will work with any mac upgraded to a 32bit operating system and Fujitsu will not be updating the ScanSnap software. I suggest looking at other options.
customer_reviews.author: mapofidaho

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner!!!! it is very compact, quiet, prompts very quickly. I love it!..... ohhhhhh one thing I absolutely hate about it. Often it will scan my document upside down and I have to spend time undoing that and if I upload it to my Adobe cloud it will upload upside down... arghhhhhh! So that part I hate and maybe I can fix it I currently just don't know how.
customer_reviews.author: SuzukiGirlBiker

customer_reviews.title: Scansnap Walked Away
customer_reviews.text: This was a good little scanner. Then Fujitsu walked away from the product and indicate deter would be no additional updates. This means if you have a Mac that was updated at all in the last year, Fujitsu decided it would be better for you to purchase a brand new scanner because they will not update the driver. What a profitable choice! Screw the customers. Let them buy a new scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: The item doesn’t work with new Mac updates. Making it useless for us to use. I can’t return it because we 30 days return policy and it took use about 4 weeks to figure this thing out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not For Windows 10!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if you are using Windows 10. It won't work and there don't appear to be any software updates to support Windows 10. Did not find that advice on Amazon reviews, which would have saved me a lot of money and time, but it is commonly acknowledged on other review sites. I hired a professional to see if he could get it to work and at least uninstall it (another common problem) to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Bad Products!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my business office to use, just as the warranty run out it stop working!! Even my IT guy could get it going. In the mean time I had purchased another one for my home office, this was in the process of the other quitting. Now the one I bought for my home office is doing the same thing as my business office ScanSnap did!! I should have know better............$600.00 tossed away, now I have two that do notwork!!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: TLHCoffey

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use...the first hour I used it. When I went to use it the next day, it was broken already! Wouldn’t do anything. And I hadn’t moved it or touched it since using it the day before. Emailed tech support and got no help back. Just “sounds like it’s not connecting”. Oh really? Thanks for pointing it the obvious. How do I fix that?!?! I’m really bummed as I have so many papers I need to get scanned. So frustrating!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan H

customer_reviews.title: Works like brand new unit!
customer_reviews.text: My previous Fujitsu S1300 finally gave out; for its size it has been a workhorse, critical peripheral for my home office. I highly recommend this compact scanner because it has big girl features for a very small footprint. The unit I bought from Amazon unit had been previously purchased and returned. It arrived in great condition but one of the cables was missing. I contacted Amazon about this and was given an extra 10% discount which more than offset the cost of me obtaining a replacement cable.
customer_reviews.author: TrekHer

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good but bad for me. I am using for what it's not designed for, which scanning ID cards. The card doesn't scan through in a straight shot because it has to bend a little. It gets stuck and I have to nudge it. Not bad for a product that came out in 2014 or so. But I can't give it bad marks for that. It's a great simple to use document and business card scanner. It acts up if you bump the shoot too much because it turns it on and off.. I like this thing though. Outdated software, but everything still works.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cassell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second ScanSnap. I had to replace my original as it was no longer receiving SW updates and the original was not supported on the latest Mac OS. The hardware and software are generally excellent - though finding the setting to create a searchable PDF is complicated in the latest SW version. This is a product that just works - it's very well made and will provide years of service. The included software provides all the functionality needed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MorpheusNC

customer_reviews.title: Want a terrific scanner?
customer_reviews.text: I've used Fujitsu scanners for business purposes and for personal use. My first encounter was when we decided to evolve to digital files at the Parks Department. There were about two thousand files with an unnumbered amount of paperwork in each file. It was tedious - devastatingly tedious - work. But thanks to the larger version of this scanner (the S1500i, I think) it was better than it would have been had we used the large printer/scanner or a flatbed or any other scanner for that matter.... and now, for my smaller, home business, I am enjoying the S1300i! No other scanners than Fujitsu scanners for this worker!
customer_reviews.author: Abel Cedeno

customer_reviews.title: Convient Scanning at your Desktop and TO your Desktop Computer
customer_reviews.text: Great for easy access to scanning documents to my computer at work! Double side scans as well and you can rotate and edit the scan easily. They provide the CD software to use and it is as easy to use as 1-2-3. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Printer

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner - Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a bit expensive. But trust me, you will not be disappointed. I actually have two of these now. One for work and one for home. I do A LOT of scanning because I hate holding onto paper. This scanner does a great job and handles everything I throw at it. It's auto-duplex mode, so it scans both sides and automatically skips pages that are blank. Plus, it's really small. Doesn't take up much room on your desk at all and once you close it, you can push it back under your monitor and it's out of your way completely.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fantastic tech support.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for home use. I scanned boxes of old letters, pictures and newspaper clippings. It did a great job. The scanner will take legal size documents down to 3x2 wallet size photos easily. I will say the troubleshooting / help guide is pretty lean on information. When I had a problem the guide was not helpful but the telephone tech support was great. I spoke with a tech in California who answered my call pretty quickly and even showed me some extra features I could use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer RM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel. Or home. What I needed all along.
customer_reviews.text: This was not my first portable scanner, but it has all the features I wish the first one had: - Easy multi-sheet feed (just don't overfeed it!) - Two-sided scanning (and that's the default setting) - Detects if there's a blank page and deletes it - USB connection and power -- no power adapter needed - Fits in my Hermit Shell with the Canon printer This with the Canon Pixma iP110 (see photo) and Hermit Shell carrier make a perfect travel kit for anyone who needs scanner/printer for the road.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T. Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner!
customer_reviews.text: After seven years of heavy use, this scanner is still going strong! I use it almost every day since it's small enough to stay out on my desk. And it's helped me control the overwhelming paper clutter that comes flooding into my life. I can scan everything and get rid of the hard copies. Tips: (1) If you have different size pages, scan the largest sheet first. Otherwise it pauses and asks if you meant to scan different sizes. (2) Sometimes I have to hand-feed paper with different thicknesses (e.g., a stack of utility bills).
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Returning...Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Right out the box, wouldn’t work properly. Feeds in multiple pages at one time. Would sometimes feed one page, but half way through, would suck all the rest of the paper in too. Keeps jamming because of that. Also doesn’t always scan a clear image. Text was blurry. Would include a blank back page and think a crease in the page was an image. If you’re scanning one document at a time with large text, this would work great. But what’s the point of an auto feeder?
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner with a relatively tiny footprint
customer_reviews.text: Love this mighty midget! It's been a huge help in my efforts to go paperless (as much as possible) in our household. I enjoy taking a little time each night to scan documents into PDFs and get the clutter out of our filing cabinets--hopefully I will eventually have just a handful of folders remaining with the docs (e.g., notarized, or signed original legal docs) that I can not toss out. I can't give a detailed review of the included software suite. I typically just use it to convert all scanned docs into PDF format, but it is does the job without hassling me. Two accessories you must buy if you get this scanner: a staple remover and a shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small scanner to put on my desk top to scan receipts and that type of thing. I had a few starts and stops getting it set up. I ended up having to go online and download drviers because I could not get the CD to work. About a week after I set it up and used it quite a bit, it came up with some error and I basically had to delete all the drivers and reinstall. Now it works like a charm and I am very pleased. As long as I don't keep running into that error message, I'm very happy with this product. It is compact and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.... you won't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: My second unit. Bought to expand my office. Bulletproof operation for years. 50% faster than the S1300 and the software is good. Look on YouTube to find easy ways to set up profiles and use the full feature set of the software. So-so for photos, but awesome for office documents, OCR, and getting the paper clutter out of your way for good. I highly recommend Documentsnap.com website for paperless workflow hints and tutorials. That was the reason I bought the first scanner, and now we couldn't do without it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Fujitsu's technical support is good when they get around to it. Unfortun
customer_reviews.text: Fujitsu's technical support sucks. Unfortunately for them, Apple apparently did not make it easy to update the product software in time to accommodate it's switch to a 64-bit only operating system. As a result I was on the verge of dumping a recently purchased portable scanner, rendered useless by the change, until Fujitsu finally issued a software patch that allowed its scanners to work on the all 64-bit Apple operating systems.
customer_reviews.author: E. White

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! Been using it for over a year and very happy
customer_reviews.text: I really do love this scanner. I have had it about two years now and use it to scan everything into PDFs, all my receipts and bills and invoices. No more boxes of receipts to keep and all my records are in my laptop now, accessiblecto me always. It’s fast, it’s clean, it’s smallxenough to be portable. Very happy. I also scan business cards but do not seem to access them as much.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Sands Entertainment

customer_reviews.title: Good little scanner
customer_reviews.text: I've scanned in several documents to pdf files and lots of pictures to jpeg files. Overall, I'm very satisfied. The scanner is small, fast, has accurate scanning, and rarely has problems feeding pages or photos through. I took away one star because with no twain support you have to use their software, which I found somewhat confusing at first although eventually I got the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: veeblefetzer

customer_reviews.title: very well built machine
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this very long but after all the reviews I read I thought I'd mention something I didn't read anywhere and that's an explanation of exactly HOW FAST this thing is.... It scans as if it's just pushing paper straight through. It scans faster that any printer I've ever seen prints, including the gas station laser receipts or thermal printers. It's really FAST. As far as jams, it has warnings about certain materials but it pushes flimsy receipts through really well. When people say it's a nice scanner, that's an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is great! I am scanning old books from my personal library to save digitally. This scanner scans duplex without any assistance from me! And I can combine the pages without any problems. I wished I would have bought this scanner a long time ago! I can't wait to scan other personal documents and receipts to downsize paper in my personal office/library.
customer_reviews.author: abscott1703

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use since they will not update their software!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and not cannot use it. Apparently they wrote their software for 32bit machines and it is not compatible with 64bit updates. I use a MacBook, and when I updated I could no longer use the scanner... and I have been waiting months for them to push out a scanner update but they have not. They clearly just want people to buy the newer model rather than taking care of the model they already have out.
customer_reviews.author: Dade

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: Scan quality is good but the feeder is garbage. I bought this as an addition to the other two ScanSnap products I have - ix500 and ix1500. Such a disappointment compared to the other two. I didn't expect the same functionality but you can't scan more than one page at a time. Even two seem to trip it up. Unless you need something more high end like the ix500, you can find much cheaper scanners or MFPs that are more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Chubbs00

customer_reviews.title: Super quick and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Used this at work and hoped it would be a good fit to get 10 years of taxes scanned and shredded. After 2 years of procrastination, hooray! Taxes are digitized. Love that this duplexes automatically or can just as easily simplex with a click. Software installed without a hitch and the few pictures I scanned looked good to me. Might not be the best photo scanner for high res images. Will make it much easier to preserve important documents and family memories that have been hanging around in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: K Griffee

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set the scanner up to my laptop
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Fujitsu Scansnap 13p0i for my new business office. The scanner arrived on the estimated date. It was easy to set the scanner up to my laptop. I use it everyday. I purchased this scanner because I used to use the same make and model at my full time job before I retired. It's a great scanner. I purchased another one for my business partner. This is a real review. I used my own money to purchase two of them. Ur
customer_reviews.author: Lenci

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: Going to Fujitsu's website was a bit tricky, but once the software was loaded dot my laptop, this scanner works like a charm! I am satisfied with it, and highly recommend it for it's simplicity and ease of use. Receipts are straightened automatically, it has duplex scanning capabilities, and a host of other nice features you'll appreciate. The build quality of this scanner far surpasses that of the Canon I have for my business.
customer_reviews.author: MilwaukeeTim

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup works like a charm love the double side ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup works like a charm love the double side scan. The only thing is it did not have the 64 bit app. This makes me get a notice on my iMac of the problem. The unit was pretty much plug and play setup. I used the web didn't have a cd to use even though it came with one for pc or mac.
customer_reviews.author: anthony kempf

customer_reviews.title: Nice size- nice feature set
customer_reviews.text: Neat scanner. Smaller than I had anticipated, which is GREAT. It took almost 20 minutes to install the software-- I thought it would take forever-- but once the software was installed, I plugged it into my laptop, then off to the races. A VERY nice upgrade from my Canon flat bed scanner-- I really like how it scans both sides of the paper at the same time and makes automatic adjustments. Most of my needs are to turn documents into PDFs, and this really does the trick. When I'm done, I fold the top and bottom, then tuck it away until I need it again.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Statham

customer_reviews.title: CRUMBLES PAPERS AND DOES NOT FEED STRAIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This is my first scan job. Software installed great. I had 12 pages to scan. The problem is in the grabbing and feeding. I started with one paper at a time. Every other one when in crooked. Then I began feeding 5 papers at a time. I had to assist every now and then by pushing and tapping on the top for feeding of paper to begin. Then I had papers start to feed so crooked that the paper crumbled and a jam occurred. This happened three times. None of the reviews mentioned this problem,otherwise, I probably would not have bought this unit. I am not happy, but I will probably keep it.
customer_reviews.author: jpvela

customer_reviews.title: Terrible software for Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: The software required to use this scanner is almost unusable in Windows 10. The window renders to a tiny size, and is neither resizable or scrollable, so you can only click the parts that are visible in the tiny window. I can't configure anything about this scanner because of it. It looks like one workaround might be to install their scansnap organizer, but I'm worried about loading even more useless proprietary garbage onto my PC.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hammer

customer_reviews.title: None of the functionality promised
customer_reviews.text: Chose this scanner for home use... to finally get rid of the piles of paperwork here and there. All the workflow and organizational functionality sold me, searchable PDFs, the ability to organize and tag files, scanning different sizes of paper and smart OCR reading etc. NONE of that delivered. It scanned... but that's it. After multiple downloads using the out of date disk provided and going online for updates, Fujitsu support was useless, and so was this little scanner.
customer_reviews.author: N. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great compact scanner!
customer_reviews.text: We full-time in an RV and wanted to scan all of our paper files so that we did not have all that extra weight and storage. We researched online on all kinds of different scanners and decided on the Scan Snap. It is very compact, so I was a bit nervous about the quality. But after setting it up and using it, it works like a champ! Very fast and does all sizes of paper. The software took me a bit to get used to, but it makes sense after a bit of a warm up period. I would definitely recommend this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Carson

customer_reviews.title: Five years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: In a burst of Marie Kondo-inspired decluttering, I'm scanning and getting rid of some boxes of bills, papers, and photos with my trusty ScanSnap. I just looked up when I purchased it from Amazon and turns out it was the summer of 2014. In the nearly 5 years I've had this scanner, I've had no problems. There's a bit of a learning curve but all in all, it's been great. I've definitely gotten my money's worth, and here's hoping it keeps kicking for a few more years.
customer_reviews.author: R13

customer_reviews.title: Worst scanner ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been fiddling with my new Fujitsu scanner for months, and I feel so ripped off. I cannot put any type of paper in the feeder and have it go through the first time. It takes constant pushing and aligning and redoing. For this price, I expected much better. I've had a Fujitsu scanner for probably 30 years and thought I'd get a new one. Don't do it. I gave it 2 because it works eventually, but the quality is too frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky orchid

customer_reviews.title: Best portable scanner around!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is awesome. I've had it more than 3 years now. It folds up nicely to not take up too much space, then expands to allow for a ten-page document feeder (you can easily fit 12-13 pages but don't push it). It's fast, quiet, and couldn't be easier to use. I love this thing! Fujitsu scanners are the best and this is another example of that.
customer_reviews.author: David Gettler

customer_reviews.title: love this scanner!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the easiest scanner I've used. It's lightweight, compact and efficient. I have purchased 2 and gave 1 to a client. They love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Benson

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, mediocre software
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this scanner for about five years. It's a great piece of hardware: pretty fast scanning, the document feeder works well with different size documents, and can hold 10-15 pages at a time, and the scan quality is very good. The software package is a bit lackluster, and doesn't lead to totally fluid workflows, but it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best thing that has ever happened to me
customer_reviews.text: Do they have 10 stars?!?!?!!! I don't know how I lived without this. My house is becoming a paperless house and you should have seen it before. (No, you shouldn't have seen it before!) I have even taken my knitting patterns, beading patterns, ... and scanned them. My patterns are now easier to find and I can always print a copy if I NEED one. The absolute best thing that has ever happened to me. I love Fujitsu. Whenever I have a choice, I choose Fujitsu. They are known to me as delivering a product far beyond what their competitors do. more features, great quality, for a lower price. They've never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: NHS

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase if you are a MAC user
customer_reviews.text: I just recently purchased my scan snap S1300i in August of 2019. I just learned there are no updates available for this scanner if I upgrade my Mac to the newest 10.15 Catalina. It is not supported and the Scan Snap software will no longer open. They say I need to purchase a newer version? This was a $250 +/- purchase and I can't even it use it! I am wondering if I can return it. This should have been disclosed when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMommy

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money on the ix1500, not this portable one
customer_reviews.text: I'm probably spoiled because I used to use the higher quality 50-page S1500 scanner. I had purchased it in 2012. It no longer worked with the latest version of Mac OS software - bummer. So I thought I'd save money and buy the 10-page Fujitsu and not the 50-page. I didn't realize it was way less powerful and robust. If I'd never had the S1500 maybe I'd like this portable one. But I can't unknow what I know!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Hadlock

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!  Fails after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Complete piece of junk. Like others’, stopped working after about 10 gentle uses in 3 months. It doesn’t power on, it’s just dead. It’s apparent this product has a power issue, it should be pulled out of market by now. Contacted Fujitsu, they told us it’s still under warranty. However the form they sent us to fill out asks for CC info for minimum $109 repair charge, no mentioning of warranty repair whatsoever. Very sneaky. They won’t pay for shipping for both ways either. I have to say this has been one of the worse retail experiences ever.
customer_reviews.author: papaya500

customer_reviews.title: Not Updated to Work Easily with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: We loved this when we bought it many years ago. Lately our old one was getting to be unreliable. We’d have to uninstall and reinstall the software to get it to work, so we ordered a new one. This has the same issues. There’s lots of advice on how to work around this problem. I think the company should update their own software and figure it out. Since the newer one works like our older one, we are returning this.
customer_reviews.author: T. a Simmons

customer_reviews.title: last 2 were Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I have had two s1300i's, one at work and one at home, since 2012. Has been a great scanner- used it in both places everyday. the home scanner stopped working 9/1/18. A six year life is not bad. I ordered a replacement from Amazon. It was DOA. I returned it and ordered a second s1300i. It, too, was DOA. I returned it. I am so disappointing- i wanted this model and wanted it to work. Trying to decide if I try again with another supplier (maybe Amazon got a bad batch). But there should never be any bad batches. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs but beware.,
customer_reviews.text: ... I just got a notice that Scans Ap is not supportive g further Mac upgrades. So, since I have two of these, a $500 investment in two countries, I am reluctant to upgrade my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great mobile scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner. I had a Neat scanner for about three years. It finally stopped working. After reading reviews on several I decided to buy the Fujitsu. I've had the scanner for about ten days and so far this has done a great job. The only reason I didn't give it a five star is that it could use a little more robust software. That being said I scan to Evernote and is working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Works ok if you're only scanning one document
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small scanner to scan client documents. There doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason as to why it jams. Same type of paper, different paper, fresh out of the printer, folded and straightened out again. Sometimes it registers a jam when there isn't one, and other times it will feed 2 pieces of paper in at once and not even skip a beat. I've found that some of the scans are skewed, and other times the software will automatically rotate a document upside down. Unreliable at best. Packing it up and sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife who travels a lot. She LOVEs it. Simple to use. loves the one-touch automatic feature. automatically recognizes color or black and white, and simplex vs duplex. Only issue she's had is when scanning hard plastic credit cards -- does not feed properly. Other than that, for everyday and business scanning, she loves it! and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: This scanner MIGHT be good for you if your primary concern is having a ...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner MIGHT be good for you if your primary concern is having a compact sized scanner... and if you only scan one or two pages at a time... and if scan speed is not important to you. I have another Fujitsu ScanSnap (larger one) that I love, so I had high hopes for this. I was very disappointed. Scanning speed was super slow. And right from the first scan (of 10 pages), it grabbed 3 pages at once, resulting in a paper jam. This is definitely getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware let down by subpar software
customer_reviews.text: Scan quality is great. However, I frequently end up scanning the same document several times to get it in the format and resolution I need. Also, every time I connect the scanner I have to restart the computer otherwise it doesn't detect it. no driver errors or anything. Just poor software.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: An update to an already amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple gripes with the software, but in my experience, it is the best. The software gives you many usable options to transfer and deal with files. The hardware is amazing. The simple one-button functionality and portability of the device are wonderful aspects of a truly amazing design. I work on a PC, but I know this device works well with mobile. This product was pushed out after Fujitsu's larger model Fujitsu iX500. This basically takes the cake on every level.
customer_reviews.author: Robotech Industries

customer_reviews.title: Small, quick, quite and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a quick, small, high res scanner that works with Simple Scan on a Linux box. This one turned out to be a peach! A little tweaky to add to SANE but there is plenty of advice about it on line. Was not difficult. Works GREAT on Ubuntu 18.08 LTS. Just drop a few sheets into the feeder, select the menu choice in Simple Scan to scan both sides automatically and save the PDF. It never misses. Do note that it is USB only. No Cat 5 or WiFi interface. If you want to make it a network resource, it will need a host.
customer_reviews.author: LongRunner262

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Fujitsu
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this product five stars if it had come with a twain driver. I probably would not have bought this if I had known that it did not have a twain driver interface. I understand that Fujitsu did this to appease an audience of users who don't want to deal with complicated driver interfaces however not having the twain interface forces you to use Fujitsu's values for scanning and limits it's true ability to interface with other scanning software.
customer_reviews.author: pcjunki

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner but setup is difficult.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner but is very quirky to setup and use to eliminate all the pop ups. If you are going to use this for document storage, read carefully about PDF setup and selecting OCR and for all pages. Forget using the included SCANSNAP software and use Evernote which is added as an "additional application". I am a techie and it took me over 2 hours to get this configured and running the way I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Crap software, fails to work frequently
customer_reviews.text: I have had to delete and reload the software multiple times as every few scans, the software stops working. It is highly unreliable and frequently stops working mid scan. I would not recommend. It is an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Super quick and easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Based on many reviews this is the scanner for me. Scans both sides in seconds, portable (we have more than one house and I want to digitize files in all). I wish I would've had this years ago and maybe, just maybe, I might not have accumulated SO much paper. Going through and deciding that there is much I never should've hung on to (but now glad I have it on my computer). Awesome device.
customer_reviews.author: Julie McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Soooo much better than multifunction printers!
customer_reviews.text: If you're tired of trying to scan using a multifunction printer this is exactly what you need. Small, easy to use, excellent user interface and high quality scans. Highly recommend this product! Five Stars ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐
customer_reviews.author: dilworthdude

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. The scanned copy is clear and comes out straight. It replaced my HP Officejet Pro 8620 printer that had scanning capability but those scans always came our crooked and blurry. After scanning, it gives you the option to save to Dropbox, Evernote and a variety of other options to pick from. We use it for keeping track of our pets vet records, tax info and work. So convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Trina

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Document Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I've had several scanners but this is the easiest to use and takes just a little space on your desk. Two sided scanning is fast and saving in different formats is a good feature. Gets rid of the paper clutter too. You will really like it.
customer_reviews.author: lbartist

customer_reviews.title: Great device, kinda finicky
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, that being said, there are a few things that I would consider if I were you. One, it can scan receipts, however, don't do multiples at once, unless they are something you print out yourself using printer paper. Second, you have to download the software to scan receipts from the included cd-rom or from their website, the process is not too painless though. All in all it is a really awesome device, once you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Best desk top portable scanner x15 yrs!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using ScanSnap at various law firms I've worked in over the past 15 yrs. I purchased my own to put on my desk, and wanted this small one so I could take it home for scanning too. I've been using it now for several months, and it's holding up very well. ScanSnap is #1 in portable scanning in my opinion!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandee

customer_reviews.title: PAPER JAMS EVERY TIME
customer_reviews.text: I wish I wasn't lazy and returned this right away. Every time I scan a few papers, a page will always get stuck. I'll be lucky if only one page gets stuck, but it is usually a few. I have to open it up and reload the stack EVERY TIME. I spoke with customer service and they advised me to clean a few parts with alcohol. Didn't make a difference. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ™

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: ScanSnap has been a long-time favorite of mine - a real work horse, easy to use and perfect for the travelling attorney! Unfortunately, my husband has poached this one, so I may have to order another! Software is easy to install and set up. It works wired or wirelessly and the scans are far superior quality to my other printer/copier/scanner. Also, on the few times I have had to call support (usually because of a Windows 10 issue) they have been responsive and ALWAYS resolve the issue - even if it is NOT a problem with their hardware / software.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A high-end, quality portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fujitsu scanner at work that has never failed in all the years we've used it, so I fully anticipated that this portable scanner would be of the same quality. I am pleased to report that it is. It works very well, and the scanned images are great. The one-pass/two-sided scanning is great when needed, and the software that comes with works very well. The unit is portable, though on the slightly heavier side, so it needs its own pocket in your laptop carrier, or its own case if you are going to carry it around as you do a laptop. Very nice piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this portable scanner. It is a great substitute for my Fujitsu desktop scanner when I must travel. Images are sharp and crisp and I like that it will do multiple pages, as well as duplex. The paper guides don't seem to keep the paper straight very well, and I have to baby documents a bit to guide them through, but the software does a good job of straightening out the images even if the paper goes through a little bit crooked. All in all, it's a good scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Lori E.

customer_reviews.title: Good scans with supportive software
customer_reviews.text: The scans are easy to do and the software does a wonderful conversion job. It is certainly portable as well, but this is not something I need. It is easy to scan receipts. The only difficult receipts are things like long grocery receipts. It would also be nice to edit some of the pull-down option lists.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth E. Tonnessen

customer_reviews.title: ScanSnap Quality in a Compact Unit
customer_reviews.text: ScanSnap software is excellent on this scanner. The scans look great. The paper feed was my only issue as it often jams, twist a page, and will not scan multiple pages without holding them so all doesn't pull through at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing if you owned the previous (32-bit) version
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my trusty Fujitsu scanner (5-star; worked flawlessly) when the Mac OS went to 64-bit only. I got the equivalent model. Unfortunately, it isn't the same quality, either the hardware or the software. The biggest problem is the poor paper feed. Too often bunches of pages feed through together, necessitating a rescan or scanning just a few pages at a time and then assembling a larger PDF in parts. A big disappointment compared to the version I had to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Mac and PC ready - must use the provided software
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner and pretty much a plug and play once you install the software. Note: you must use the software. It is NOT TWAIN compliant. It is dependent upon the software. Did I mention you must install the provided software? Used this on both a Mac and a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Igeaoux

customer_reviews.title: Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for mobile business. UPDATE: We have only used the scanner a couple of times, and now it is "FROZE" and will not allow scanning. A blue light stays on and will not change. I have tired unplugging, leaving unplugged for some time, still nothing. I can not see that there is anything in the buffer or the que or whatever, but it is not operable and the return window has passed. Now it is an expensive paper weight. Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Big power in a small package.
customer_reviews.text: I "downgraded" from a Fujitsu ix500 to the S1300i when I took a new job and began traveling internationally several months at a time. This scanner has kept me sane and organized; big power in a small package. I am very pleased with it. It is not as good as the ix500 for major bulk scanning, but I only occasionally have to scan an entire book anymore, and even when I do, it is not a terrible experience. Excellent quality, good value, couldn't be happier with the size of the printer. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Skidtz

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact, not perfect but great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Some minor jams, wish there was better integration with outlook (business cards), ok software, OCR not great. But super convenient, mostly scans great, love the small footprint and very mobile on my desk. Nice long cords and size make it easy to move out of the way when not in use. Overall I really do like it way better than using my HP Laserjet or Epson Inkjet for most things. Biggest flaw: When scanning receipts, if they are longer than what they call 'standard paper length' or something like that it refuses to save it. That is annoying. But all in all, I'm really glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A. Martinache

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little scanner!
customer_reviews.text: What’s great little scanner. I have one for my home business and purchased this one for a non profit that’s started to go paperless. This scanner is perfect for a home office or moderate scanning in an office setting. It scans through a ton of documents quickly, and I like how I can customize the settings each time I scan. Excellent scanner at a reasonable price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: The scanner worked for one month and then stopped working ...
customer_reviews.text: The scanner worked for one month and then stopped working. Powers on but will not scan. Disconnected and reconnected, on two separate computers, but still doesn't work. VERY EXPENSIVE product for one month of use! Have a message in to technical support... may modify this review if some sort of resolution is achieved.
customer_reviews.author: swapski

customer_reviews.title: Great small scanner
customer_reviews.text: Very compact scanner, that is so easy to setup and use, the software is quite good and the scanner as with most Fujitsu products is excellent, rarely jams, can run through multiple pages in either simplex or duplex mode. Replaced a compact Brother scanner which was not nearly as easy to use or as good.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bancroft

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scanner!
customer_reviews.text: The ScanSnap is a great scanner. It is so easy and efficient to use. Set up only took about 2 minutes to do as the instructions guided me through getting all the updated software/drivers. I scanned through years of bills in just a couple minutes. Definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Spattz
